intro: Cineraria tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cineraria tomentosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and blooms.
